content.description:
This is a fun route up the middle of The Penthouse.  It starts off steep and gradually kicks back to a slab at the top. 
  
 The crux comes up high just before a cruiser slab section before the anchors.  This is a long pitch that requires a 2-rope rappel or a walk-off from the top.

Middle of the Penthouse, just on the left edge of the long undercut section.
Mixed protection-- easy climbing for the first 20ft. requires a couple of pieces of gear to ~2", then it's bolts from there.

Looks so great from the bottom, but once you pull the (quite fun) roof at 10a it's really just runout 5.6/7 low-angle face on poor-quality rock.  
  
 Nice view though, but nothing you wouldn't get anywhere else on The Chief.

The first route you pass as you walk out onto the ledge. You should be able to see two bolts from the bottom, quite closely spaced, protecting the roof that you pull in the first section.
Six bolts with a fixed anchor at the top. You can walk off.

The Penthouse is a section of The Chief that lies above the Grand Wall, just below the south summit.  It is home to a handful of sport and mixed routes in the 5.10 to 5.11 range, and offers spectacular views from moderate single-pitch climbs.
